p: Mentha species are rich in polyphenols [ 18] and, moreover, contain caffeic acid and its derivatives caftaric acid, cinnamic acid, ferulic acid, and oleanolic acid [ 19, 20, 21]. Flavonoids including luteolin and its derivatives apigenin, acacetin, diosmin, salvigenin and thymonin, have also been detected in these plants, accounting for some 10â€“70 compounds out of the total phenolics, and also flavanols such as catechin, epicatechin and coumarins, including esculetin and scopoletin [ 22, 23, 24, 25]. With regard to mint compositions, the essential oils represent a major focus. They are colorless, pale yellow or greenish yellow [ 26] and alcohols, ketones, esters, ethers and oxides are their main components in Mentha species [ 13, 27]. Menthol, menthone, isomenthone, menthyl acetate, linalool, linalyl acetate, lippione, pulegone, carvone, piperitenone oxide and cis-piperitone epoxide are the main constituents of essential oils prepared from different mint species [ 13, 28, 29, 30].
